summary: ICP full-stack food ordering starter app (React/Vite + Tailwind/shadcn-ui with Internet Identity auth; Motoko backend) now includes expanded seeded restaurant/menu data (Tamil Nadu + seafood items), restaurant and menu-item images via `imageUrl` fields with state migration/backfill, UI rendering of photos across restaurant list/detail pages with fallbacks, and an app-wide food-themed background.
architectural_notes: Frontend: React + Vite + Tailwind with shadcn-ui component library scaffolded and available for feature UI.
Auth: Internet Identity used for login; authenticated UI enforced via RequireAuth and identity/actor hooks.
Backend: Motoko canister includes modular authorization/access-control (mixin-style) integrated into main canister.
Data access: Frontend uses typed canister bindings (.did -> TS) and a central actor hook for backend calls.
State management: Cart is managed client-side via React context; orders/restaurants fetched via dedicated hooks.
Images: Restaurant and MenuItem now include `imageUrl` fields end-to-end (seed/model/IDL/bindings/UI) with a conditional state migration to backfill pre-existing records.
UI: Restaurants list and restaurant detail pages render image assets via a shared image component with fallback handling.
Theming: App shell applies a global food-themed background with light/dark mode readability.

Build template: `build-template/` now contains a complete multi-package scaffold (frontend + backend) with pnpm workspace config, extensive shadcn-ui components, custom ESLint rules, and image tooling scripts (resize/prune) for maintaining asset sets.

Decision: auto-generate new images for the 5 North Indian menu items (Chicken Tikka Masala, Paneer Makhani, Jeera Rice, Butter Naan (2 pcs), Gajar Halwa) rather than sourcing specific provided photos.
known_issues: Some food/menu item images do not match their current item names (imageUrl/mapping mismatch), requiring immediate correction.
Restaurant UI still shows incorrect images for some items/restaurants (imageUrl/mapping mismatch not fully resolved).
Dosa menu item images are incorrect/need replacement; ensure correct images are used consistently across the application.
Deployed UI still shows images as not visible (likely due to missing/incorrect imageUrl values or asset filenames not present at the referenced paths).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Wide photo-realistic restaurant cover image featuring a pizza spread on a rustic table with warm lighting (restaurant-pizza-palace-cover.dim_1200x600.png)
- Square photo-realistic dish image of a Margherita pizza with basil leaves and melted mozzarella (dish-margherita-pizza.dim_512x512.png)
- Square photo-realistic dish image of a pepperoni pizza with crispy pepperoni slices and browned cheese (dish-pepperoni-pizza.dim_512x512.png)
- Square photo-realistic dish image of a Hawaiian pizza with pineapple chunks, ham, and melted cheese (dish-hawaiian-pizza.dim_512x512.png)
- Square photo-realistic dish image of garlic breadsticks with visible garlic-butter glaze and parmesan (dish-garlic-breadsticks.dim_512x512.png)
- Square photo-realistic dish image of a Caesar salad with romaine, croutons, parmesan shavings, and creamy dressing (dish-caesar-salad.dim_512x512.png)

generatedImages.description: Food-themed background pattern for global app shell

existing_features.title: Internet Identity authentication UI and session handling
existing_features.description: Frontend supports signing in/out with Internet Identity, protects authenticated routes/components, and exposes identity/actor via hooks.

existing_features.title: User profile setup flow
existing_features.description: Frontend prompts/collects initial user profile information and loads current user profile state for authenticated users.

existing_features.title: Restaurants browsing and detail views
existing_features.description: Frontend provides a restaurants list and restaurant detail page, with data-fetching hooks to load restaurant data from backend.

existing_features.title: Cart management (client-side)
existing_features.description: Client-side cart state management with add/update/remove items and a dedicated cart page.

existing_features.title: Order placement workflow
existing_features.description: Frontend can submit an order (from cart) to the backend using a dedicated hook and query-state handling.

existing_features.title: Orders list and order detail views
existing_features.description: Authenticated users can view a list of their orders and drill into individual order details.

existing_features.title: Motoko backend canister with authorization/access control mixins
existing_features.description: Backend includes reusable authorization/access-control components integrated into the Motoko canister entrypoint.

existing_features.title: Typed backend bindings and actor creation in frontend
existing_features.description: Frontend includes generated/checked .did TypeScript declarations and utilities/hooks to create a typed backend actor for calls.

existing_features.title: Application layout and shared UI primitives
existing_features.description: Frontend includes a main app layout, query/loading/error state component, and a large set of shadcn-ui components wired into the project.

existing_features.title: Build/deploy template for ICP full-stack app
existing_features.description: Repository includes an ICP build/deploy template (docker/build scripts, canister configs, workspace/pnpm config) for the full-stack app.

existing_features.title: Backend `imageUrl` support for restaurants and menu items with migration/backfill
existing_features.description: Motoko backend data model now includes `imageUrl : Text` for `Restaurant` and `MenuItem`, returns these fields from restaurant/menu query APIs, and includes a conditional migration to preserve existing canister state while backfilling missing `imageUrl` values.

existing_features.title: Expanded seeded restaurant and menu data (Tamil Nadu + seafood additions)
existing_features.description: Seeded data now includes additional restaurants and significantly expanded menus including Tamil Nadu veg/non-veg/meals and Chettinad-style items plus a seafood set; seed ID counters are updated to remain correct after seeding.

existing_features.title: Restaurant and menu item photos rendered in UI with fallbacks
existing_features.description: Frontend now displays restaurant photos in the restaurants list and restaurant + menu item photos in the restaurant detail menu item cards using `imageUrl`, with a reusable fallback image component/logic; cart add/remove behavior remains intact.

existing_features.title: App-wide food-themed background styling (light/dark readable)
existing_features.description: Frontend applies a global food-themed background across the application while maintaining readability for text/components in both light and dark mode.

existing_features.title: Expanded build-template workspace (React/Vite + shadcn-ui) with tooling scripts and lint rules
existing_features.description: Repository now includes a more fully populated `build-template/` workspace containing a React/Vite frontend scaffold with shadcn-ui components, associated configs (pnpm workspace, TS/Vite/PostCSS/Tailwind), custom ESLint rules, and helper scripts for image resizing and pruning unused images alongside backend canister template files.

existing_features.title: Add new static image assets for the Burger Joint and Pasta House restaurants and their menu items under `frontend/public/assets/generated`, using the exact filenames specified in the Image Requirements section.

Update frontend image resolution logic so Pasta House and Burger Joint (and their menu items) resolve to the new generated image filenames, including name-based fallbacks (e.g., if an older backend URL is present or empty).

Audit all seeded menu items and ensure each item’s `imageUrl` resolves to an image that matches the current `name` (no cross-item mismatches). For Pizza Palace items in particular, stop using unrelated placeholder images (e.g., garlic bread) for pizza dishes.

Add/extend frontend name-based dish image resolution so that when a menu item’s name changes, the displayed image follows the updated name reliably (including trimming/case normalization and handling common punctuation/parentheticals).
Ensure the UI consistently uses the centralized image resolution helpers for dish and restaurant images (so fixes in fallback mappings apply everywhere images are rendered).

Update frontend dish image fallback behavior so non-dosa menu items never display the dosa image just because an image URL is missing/legacy; use a neutral generic dish fallback instead, and only show the dosa image when the dish name is actually "Dosa".

Refine the frontend legacy/invalid image URL detection in `frontend/src/utils/imageFallbacks.ts` so that valid existing static asset URLs are not incorrectly treated as legacy and forced to fall back to the generic placeholder (which previously caused dosa to appear widely).

Ensure the dosa menu item image itself is high-quality and visually correct by updating the existing generated dosa asset, and ensure all occurrences of the dosa image in the UI correspond to the Dosa dish only.

Ensure every menu item displays an image that matches the menu item’s current `name` by using name-based image resolution whenever the backend `imageUrl` is missing, empty, or points to a known legacy/incorrect asset.

Remove cross-item mismatches in the centralized dish-name mapping so that Pizza Palace items (Margherita Pizza, Pepperoni Pizza, Hawaiian Pizza, Garlic Breadsticks, Caesar Salad) do not map to unrelated dish images (e.g., garlic bread or veg meals) and instead resolve to a neutral generic dish fallback unless a correct pizza/salad-specific asset exists.

Generate 5 new static dish images (512x512) for the Tandoori Treats menu items: Chicken Tikka Masala, Paneer Makhani, Jeera Rice, Butter Naan (2 pcs), and Gajar Halwa (Dessert). Add the files under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using the exact filenames specified in Image Requirements.

Update frontend dish image resolution so these 5 menu items resolve to the newly generated dish images by name-based mapping (and/or direct imageUrl), including handling the existing names with parentheticals ("Butter Naan (2 pcs)", "Gajar Halwa (Dessert)").

Add new static image assets for Pizza Palace (restaurant cover + its menu items) under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using consistent `.dim_*` filenames, matching the existing generated-asset naming conventions used for other restaurants.

Update centralized frontend image resolution so Pizza Palace (restaurant name "Pizza Palace") and its menu items (Margherita Pizza, Pepperoni Pizza, Hawaiian Pizza, Garlic Breadsticks, Caesar Salad) resolve to the newly generated static assets by name-based mapping, and are displayed consistently anywhere restaurant/menu images render.

new_feature_requests.summary: Update restaurant/menu images to use the Burger Joint and Pasta House image assets (update relevant imageUrl mappings/UI as needed).

Update backend seeded `imageUrl` values so Burger Joint (restaurantId=5) and Pasta House (restaurantId=4), plus their menu items (menuItemIds 16–22, including 19), point to the new generated image asset paths (the new `.dim_*.png` filenames under `/assets/generated/`).

Implement a state upgrade migration that updates existing persisted records for Pasta House and Burger Joint (restaurants and their menu items) to the new `imageUrl` values even if older `imageUrl` values are already present, so upgraded canisters reflect the new images.
Change/update the pizza-related images (restaurant cover and/or pizza menu item images).
Fix mismatched menu item images so food items display images that match their (possibly updated) names; update any necessary imageUrl mappings and/or seeded data so changes apply immediately.

Update backend seeded `imageUrl` values for any menu items currently pointing at wrong/legacy filenames so they directly reference the correct generated static assets under `/assets/generated/` using the new `.dim_*.png` filenames (especially Pizza Palace menu items).

Implement a conditional Motoko state upgrade migration that updates persisted `MenuItem.imageUrl` values to the corrected URLs even when older values are already present, so upgraded canisters immediately reflect the fixed images.
Remove/replace the current dosa menu item images and ensure dosa (and other dishes across the app) use correct, high-quality matching images everywhere they appear.

Update backend seeded `MenuItem.imageUrl` values for South Indian items so they point to the existing `.dim_*` generated assets (at minimum: Dosa, Idly, Vada, Vegetarian Meals, Non-Veg Meals, Chicken Chettinad, Chicken 65, Pepper Chicken, Mutton Kuzhambu/Chettinad Mutton Kuzhambu), and implement a conditional state upgrade migration to update persisted records to these corrected URLs on upgrade.

Add menu item images for North Indian items: Chicken Tikka Masala, Paneer Makhani, Jeera Rice, Butter Naan (2 pcs), and Gajar Halwa (Dessert) (update seeded/persisted MenuItem.imageUrl and ensure UI renders correctly).

Update backend seeded `Restaurant.imageUrl` and `MenuItem.imageUrl` values so they reference the correct current static asset paths (especially replacing legacy `/assets/generated/*.png` values with the correct `/assets/generated/* .dim_* .png` filenames where available), so images match names immediately on a fresh deploy.

Add a conditional Motoko state upgrade migration that updates existing persisted `Restaurant.imageUrl` and `MenuItem.imageUrl` values when they are legacy/incorrect so upgraded canisters also show name-correct images without requiring a fresh deploy.

Update backend seeded `MenuItem.imageUrl` values for menuItemIds 1–5 (Tandoori Treats) to point to the new generated `/assets/generated/*.dim_512x512.png` filenames for: Chicken Tikka Masala, Paneer Makhani, Jeera Rice, Butter Naan (2 pcs), and Gajar Halwa (Dessert).

Add/extend a conditional Motoko state upgrade migration so that, on upgrade, persisted `MenuItem.imageUrl` values for menuItemIds 1–5 are updated to the new generated `/assets/generated/*.dim_512x512.png` paths even when older/legacy values are already present.

Auto-generate new static image assets for Pizza Palace (restaurant cover and its menu items) under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using consistent `.dim_*` filenames, and update seeded/migrated `imageUrl` mappings so the new images render in the UI.

Update backend seeded `imageUrl` values for Pizza Palace (restaurantId=2) and its menu items (menuItemIds 6–10) so a fresh deploy points directly to the new `/assets/generated/*.dim_*` static asset paths.

Extend the conditional Motoko state upgrade migration to update any existing persisted Pizza Palace restaurant/menu `imageUrl` values to the new `.dim_*` asset paths even when older/legacy values are already present.

projectName: Add restaurant & menu item photos, Tamil Nadu + seafood dishes, and food-themed background
